answers.A: IAM allows you to manage users, groups, and roles and their corresponding level of access to the AWS Platform.
answers.B: IAM allows you to manage users' passwords only. AWS staff must create new users for your organization. This is done by raising a ticket.
answers.C: IAM allows you to manage permissions for AWS resources only.
answers.D: IAM stands for Improvised Application Management, and it allows you to deploy and manage applications in the AWS Cloud.
